lines.text: If you've got one drop of my blood in your veins, you won't let Mattie or any of her kind break your heart, you'll go right out there and break it yourself.
Some day you won't laugh at me! I'm going out and have a real life! I'm gonna be somebody!

Esther, everyone in this world who has ever dreamed about better things has been laughed at, don't you know that? But there's a difference between dreaming and doing. The dreamers just sit around and moon about how wonderful it would be if only things were different. And the years roll on and by and by they grow and they forget everything, even about their dreams. Oh yes, you want to be somebody, but you want it to be easy. Oh you modern girls give me a pain!
What do they do with the actors while you're away?
Oh, they cut 'em into slices and fry 'em with eggs.
[last lines]
Hello, everybody. This is Mrs. Norman Maine.

[Practising her line with an accent]
Acme... Naw Shmith ain't in!
His work is beginning to interfere with his drinking.
Of course, no one ever listens to me!
They do if they're within ten miles of ya.
Do you think I'm slipping?
Can you take it?
Yeah, go ahead.
The tense is wrong. You're not slipping - you've slipped.
Now, I'm going to turn you over to our demon press agent, Libby. Don't let him frighten you. He has a heart of gold... only harder.
That's a charming match. A nice girl like Vicki and Public Nuisance Number One.
That elopement thing is out; we're gonna have a wedding. Where are we going to have it?
The customary place, I believe, is a church.

Nah! It's been done. This has gotta be something big... The beach! I can visualize it. The bridesmaids in bathing suits; twenty thousand Santa Monica school children spelling out the word "love"... but is it big enough?
I'm a pushover for him. And Chopin - well, he's not so dusty, either.

Tragedy is a test of courage. If you can meet it bravely, it will leave you bigger than it found you. If not than you will have to live all you life as a coward, because no matter where you may run you can never run away from yourself.
Do you mind if I take just one more look?
I don't want to sound immodest, but I think I've stripped a gear.

[Referring to Norman's accommodations at a sanatorium for treatment of alcoholism]
Are you comfortable here, Norman?
Comfortable? It's positively luxurious! They even have iron bars in the windows to keep out the draft.
I'm going out there and BE somebody!
